description.narrative:
The grant Supports the activities of the 92 Group in 2020 - 2022.
The stated overall objective of the project is stated as: To ensure a strong and coordinated Danish civil society, which effectively influences international fora, discussions, and decisions on sustainable development in developing countries, specifically within the areas of implementation of the SDG’s, climate action, CSR and biodiversity. Additionally, the objective is to increase public awareness of and popular engagement in development issues in Denmark.
Four strategic ambitions are stated as part of the project:
Denmark and EU are in front with an ambitious implementation of the sustainable development goals, both at national level and so that it promotes sustainable development in the global south.
Denmark, EU and the international community leads an active and progressive climate and energy policy that lives up to the Paris agreement, and secures both national action and international responsibility, that benefits the interests of the poorest and most vulnerable groups in the global south.
In Denmark, EU and globally there has been introduced sufficient framework conditions in legislation to ensure responsible and sustainable business conduct and that businesses exercise social responsibility.
Through a strong international and national effort it is ensured, that the loss of biodiversity and ecosystem functions are halted, and that there is commitment towards reaching the 20 Aichi goals, the new global biodiversity goals and the sustainable development goals.

To ensure a strong and coordinated Danish civil society, which effectively influences international fora, discussions, and decisions on sustainable development in developing countries, specifically within the areas of implementation of the SDG’s, climate action, CSR and biodiversity. Additionally, the objective is to increase public awareness of and popular engagement in development issues in Denmark
